titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Oscar P. Fitzgerald Research Files on Furniture Makers, circa 2000, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Sarah Mundy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-24 13:18:44 -0400.

did.unittitle: Oscar P. Fitzgerald research files on furniture makers
did.abstract: The papers of author, consultant, and historian Oscar P. Fitzgerald measure 0.2 linear feet and are dated circa 2000. The collection consists of Fitzgerald's research material on furniture makers that includes over 100 completed Furniture Maker's Questionnaires recording the histories and accomplishments, influences, and marketing shop practices of respondents, and a paper by Fitzgerald titled "The Movers and Shakers and How They Got There."

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Oscar P. Fitzgerald (1943- ) is an author, art consultant, and art historian in the field of decorative arts in Alexandria, Virginia. He graduated from Georgetown University earning a M.A. and Ph.D. in history. Fitzgerald was the director of the Navy Museum and is a faculty member at the Corcoran School of the Arts and Design.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection the papers are arranged as one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of author, consultant, and historian Oscar P. Fitzgerald measure 0.2 linear feet and are dated circa 2000. The collection consists of Fitzgerald's research material on furniture makers that includes over 100 Furniture Maker's Questionnaires from respondents such as Sam Maloof, Garry Knox Bennett, Linda Sue Eastman, Yuko Shimizu, and others about their histories and accomplishments, influences, and marketing and shop practices. Also found in the collection is a paper by Fitzgerald titled "The Movers and Shakers and How They Got There" that was presented to the Furniture Society in Savannah, G.A. in 2004.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Oscar P. Fitzgerald research files on furniture makers were donated in 2005 by Oscar Fitzgerald as part of the Nanette L. Laitman Documentation Project for Craft and Decorative Arts in America.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Oscar P. Fitzgerald research files on furniture makers, circa 2000. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Sarah Mundy in 2022.

controlaccess.corpname: Nanette L. Laitman Documentation Project for Craft and Decorative Arts in America

did.unittitle: Oscar P. Fitzgerald Research Files on Furniture Makers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fitzgerald's research material on furniture makers includes over 100 Furniture Maker's Questionnaires from respondents such as Sam Maloof, Garry Knox Bennett, Linda Sue Eastman, Yuko Shimizu, and others about their histories and accomplishments, influences, and marketing and shop practices. Also found in the collection is a paper by Fitzgerald titled "The Movers and Shakers and How They Got There" that was presented to the Furniture Society in Savannah, G.A. in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a list of participants in the order the questionnaires are arranged within the folders.
